lessons.htmlIntro.title: Chapter 1: The Digital Blueprint: What is HTML?
lessons.htmlIntro.welcome: Hey there, future web wizard! Ready to dive into your first mission? Today, we're uncovering the secret language of the internet: HTML! Think of it as your digital LEGO set.
lessons.htmlIntro.whatIsHtml.heading: What is HTML?
lessons.htmlIntro.whatIsHtml.text: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language. It's not a programming language like magic spells, but a markup language ‚Äì like a detailed blueprint that tells your web browser what content to display and where.
lessons.htmlIntro.whyImportant.heading: Why is HTML important?
lessons.htmlIntro.whyImportant.text: Without HTML, your browser wouldn't know if text is a title, a paragraph, or a secret message! It's the skeleton of every webpage.
lessons.htmlIntro.whyImportant.caption: Imagine trying to build a castle without a plan! That's what a webpage would be without HTML. It gives everything its place.
lessons.htmlIntro.challenge.question: Imagine you're building a tower of blocks. What does HTML help you decide?
lessons.htmlIntro.challenge.option2: Where each block goes in the tower.
lessons.htmlIntro.challenge.option3: How fast the tower falls down.
lessons.htmlIntro.challenge.correctCapti: Fantastic! That's 10 XP for your quest!
lessons.htmlIntro.challenge.incorrectCap: Almost! Remember, HTML is about structure. Give it another shot!
lessons.htmlIntro.challenge.hint: Think about what makes a webpage organized and structured.
lessons.tagsElements.title: Chapter 2: Your First Magic Words: Tags and Elements!
lessons.tagsElements.welcome: Welcome back, adventurer! Now that we know what HTML is, let's learn its basic components: Tags and Elements. These are your digital LEGO bricks!
lessons.tagsElements.whatAreTags.heading: What are Tags?
lessons.tagsElements.whatAreTags.explana:
HTML uses tags to markup (or label) content. Tags usually come in pairs: an opening tag and a closing tag . The

is the opening tag,

is the closing tag. Together, they tell the browser: "Hey, everything in between is a paragraph!"
lessons.tagsElements.whatAreElements.tex:
An element is made up of the opening tag, the closing tag, and all the content in between! So,

This is a paragraph!

is one complete HTML element.
lessons.tagsElements.challenge.question: Can you help our Web Builder Bot complete the HTML sentence?
lessons.tagsElements.challenge.instructi: Which tags would you use for a heading: "This is a heading for my webpage!"
lessons.tagsElements.challenge.correct: üéâ LEVEL UP! You just mastered your first tags!
lessons.tagsElements.challenge.correctCa: Incredible! You earned the Tag Master badge! Keep up the great work!
lessons.tagsElements.challenge.incorrect: Hmm, not quite the right spell!
Close, but not a heading tag. Think about what makes text big and bold on a page!
lessons.tagsElements.challenge.hint: Remember, headings are important for structure. Headings use numbers like h1, h2, etc.
